pull_request.title: Project app: Localise project and project_pages
pull_request.body:
Hook up `app_project` to the Panoptes `/translations` API for both the project and project page content. Workflows are already localised.
- Project translations are fetched after the project loads.
- Translated project fields are replaced by views, which are aliases for the corresponding translation strings.
- Project page translations are fetched in the page controller for each page, with the strings being added to each page as `page.strings`.
- `page.strings` is used to display the title and content of each page.

## Package
app-project

## Linked Issue and/or Talk Post

## How to Review
I've mocked a French and a Spanish locale for testing, so you should be able to browse translations, from Panoptes, for PH-TESS by adding the language code to the URL:
https://local.zooniverse.org:3000/projects/es/nora-dot-eisner/planet-hunters-tess?env=production
https://local.zooniverse.org:3000/projects/fr/nora-dot-eisner/planet-hunters-tess?env=production

# Checklist
_PR Creator - Please cater the checklist to fit the review needed for your code changes._
_PR Reviewer - Use the checklist during your review. Each point should be checkmarked or discussed before PR approval._

## General
- [ ] Tests are passing locally and on Github
- [ ] Documentation is up to date and changelog has been updated if appropriate
- [ ] You can `yarn panic && yarn bootstrap` or `docker-compose up --build` and FEM works as expected
- [ ] FEM works in all major desktop browsers: Firefox, Chrome, Edge, Safari (Use Browserstack account as needed)
- [ ] FEM works in a mobile browser

## General UX
Example Staging Project: [i-fancy-cats](https://local.zooniverse.org:3000/projects/brooke/i-fancy-cats)
- [ ] All pages of a FEM project load: Home Page, Classify Page, and About Pages
- [ ] Can submit a classification
- [ ] Can sign-in and sign-out
- [ ] The component is accessible
  - Can be used with a screen reader [BBC guide to VoiceOver](https://bbc.github.io/accessibility-news-and-you/accessibility-and-testing-with-voiceover-os.html)
  - Can be used from the keyboard [WebAIM guide to keyboard testing](https://webaim.org/techniques/keyboard/#testing)
  - It is passing accessibility checks in the storybook

## New Feature
- [ ] The PR creator has listed user actions to use when testing the new feature
- [ ] Unit tests are included for the new feature
- [ ] A storybook story has been created or updated
  - Example of SlideTutorial [component](https://github.com/zooniverse/front-end-monorepo/blob/master/packages/lib-classifier/src/components/Classifier/components/SlideTutorial/SlideTutorial.js) with docgen comments, and its [story](https://zooniverse.github.io/front-end-monorepo/@zooniverse/classifier/index.html?path=/docs/other-slidetutorial--default)

issue.body:

comment.body:
I think most of those points are addressed now:
- Document language is declared correctly on the `<html>` element.
- `fetchTranslations` has tests.
- The project and project pages set default values for strings after they load, so requests for translations that haven't been created yet won't error.
- About pages use static translations for the page headings, except in the document `<head>`.
- The test locales are empty objects.

issue.title: Project: Language middleware
issue.body:
`app-project` middleware which looks for a `language` query parameter and sets the locale.

## Package
app-project

## How to Review
Try it out with the test locale.
https://local.zooniverse.org:3000/projects/nora-dot-eisner/planet-hunters-tess/about/research?env=production&language=test

# Checklist
_PR Creator - Please cater the checklist to fit the review needed for your code changes._
_PR Reviewer - Use the checklist during your review. Each point should be checkmarked or discussed before PR approval._

## General
- [ ] Tests are passing locally and on Github

Bump webpack from 5.72.0 to 5.72.1 (#3126)

Bump yarn to 1.22.18 (#3114)

`yarn` is nagging that our version is out of date, so upgrade to latest allowed with `yarn policies set-version`.

issue.title: Project app: Localise project and project_pages
issue.body:
Hook up `app_project` to the Panoptes `/translations` API for both the project and project page content. Workflows are already localised.
- Project translations are fetched after the project loads.
- Translated project fields are replaced by views, which are aliases for the corresponding translation strings.
- Project page translations are fetched in the page controller for each page, with the strings being added to each page as `page.strings`.
- `page.strings` is used to display the title and content of each page.

## Package
app-project

## Linked Issue and/or Talk Post

## How to Review
I've mocked a French and a Spanish locale for testing, so you should be able to browse translations, from Panoptes, for PH-TESS by adding the language code to the URL:
https://local.zooniverse.org:3000/projects/es/nora-dot-eisner/planet-hunters-tess?env=production
https://local.zooniverse.org:3000/projects/fr/nora-dot-eisner/planet-hunters-tess?env=production

# Checklist
_PR Creator - Please cater the checklist to fit the review needed for your code changes._
_PR Reviewer - Use the checklist during your review. Each point should be checkmarked or discussed before PR approval._

## General
- [ ] Tests are passing locally and on Github
- [ ] Documentation is up to date and changelog has been updated if appropriate
- [ ] You can `yarn panic && yarn bootstrap` or `docker-compose up --build` and FEM works as expected
- [ ] FEM works in all major desktop browsers: Firefox, Chrome, Edge, Safari (Use Browserstack account as needed)
- [ ] FEM works in a mobile browser

## General UX
Example Staging Project: [i-fancy-cats](https://local.zooniverse.org:3000/projects/brooke/i-fancy-cats)
- [ ] All pages of a FEM project load: Home Page, Classify Page, and About Pages
- [ ] Can submit a classification
- [ ] Can sign-in and sign-out
- [ ] The component is accessible
  - Can be used with a screen reader [BBC guide to VoiceOver](https://bbc.github.io/accessibility-news-and-you/accessibility-and-testing-with-voiceover-os.html)
  - Can be used from the keyboard [WebAIM guide to keyboard testing](https://webaim.org/techniques/keyboard/#testing)
  - It is passing accessibility checks in the storybook

## New Feature
- [ ] The PR creator has listed user actions to use when testing the new feature
- [ ] Unit tests are included for the new feature
- [ ] A storybook story has been created or updated
  - Example of SlideTutorial [component](https://github.com/zooniverse/front-end-monorepo/blob/master/packages/lib-classifier/src/components/Classifier/components/SlideTutorial/SlideTutorial.js) with docgen comments, and its [story](https://zooniverse.github.io/front-end-monorepo/@zooniverse/classifier/index.html?path=/docs/other-slidetutorial--default)

comment.body:
Using the page title in a translation key is slightly dangerous, since the title is an editable field.
```js
const pageTitle = t(`About.PageHeading.title.${title.toLowerCase()}`)
```

This might be safer, since the URL key is constant.
```js
const pageTitle = t(`About.PageHeading.title.${page.url_key}`)
```

commits.message: Restore static About page titles
Better defaults for About pages
Add default strings to projects

comment.body:
>When someone tries to visit /fr/ for a project without french project translations, the app crashes instead of rendering the 404 page. I tried this on i-fancy-cats. I think there needs to be some error handling in getStaticPageProps() when strings does not exist.

After investigating a bit, Next only returns 404 if the locale is undefined. If the locale is defined, then the page is rendered. In that case, I'm adding default `strings` snapshots which should show the English language page eg. https://master.pfe-preview.zooniverse.org/projects/brooke/i-fancy-cats/?language=fr

commits.message:
Classifier: remove `inject` from QuickTalk (#3131)

`inject` is deprecated in `mobx-react`. This replaces it with the `withStores` HOC to connect `QuickTalk` to the classifier store.

- Project translations are fetched after the project loads.

issue.title: Project app: Localise project and project_pages
issue.body:
Hook up `app_project` to the Panoptes `/translations` API for both the project and project page content. Workflows are already localised.
- Project translations are fetched after the project loads.
- Translated project fields are replaced by views, which are aliases for the corresponding translation strings.
- Project page translations are fetched in the page controller for each page, with the strings being added to each page as `page.strings`.
- `page.strings` is used to display the title and content of each page.

## Package
app-project

## Linked Issue and/or Talk Post

## How to Review
I've mocked a French locale for testing, so you should be able to browse French translations, from Panoptes, for PH-TESS at:
https://local.zooniverse.org:3000/projects/fr/nora-dot-eisner/planet-hunters-tess?env=production

# Checklist
_PR Creator - Please cater the checklist to fit the review needed for your code changes._
_PR Reviewer - Use the checklist during your review. Each point should be checkmarked or discussed before PR approval._

## General
- [ ] Tests are passing locally and on Github
- [ ] Documentation is up to date and changelog has been updated if appropriate
- [ ] You can `yarn panic && yarn bootstrap` or `docker-compose up --build` and FEM works as expected
- [ ] FEM works in all major desktop browsers: Firefox, Chrome, Edge, Safari (Use Browserstack account as needed)
- [ ] FEM works in a mobile browser

## General UX
Example Staging Project: [i-fancy-cats](https://local.zooniverse.org:3000/projects/brooke/i-fancy-cats)
- [ ] All pages of a FEM project load: Home Page, Classify Page, and About Pages
- [ ] Can submit a classification
- [ ] Can sign-in and sign-out
- [ ] The component is accessible
  - Can be used with a screen reader [BBC guide to VoiceOver](https://bbc.github.io/accessibility-news-and-you/accessibility-and-testing-with-voiceover-os.html)
  - Can be used from the keyboard [WebAIM guide to keyboard testing](https://webaim.org/techniques/keyboard/#testing)
  - It is passing accessibility checks in the storybook

## New Feature
- [ ] The PR creator has listed user actions to use when testing the new feature
- [ ] Unit tests are included for the new feature
- [ ] A storybook story has been created or updated
  - Example of SlideTutorial [component](https://github.com/zooniverse/front-end-monorepo/blob/master/packages/lib-classifier/src/components/Classifier/components/SlideTutorial/SlideTutorial.js) with docgen comments, and its [story](https://zooniverse.github.io/front-end-monorepo/@zooniverse/classifier/index.html?path=/docs/other-slidetutorial--default)

comment.body:
> I don’t think fr dictionary files should be added with duplicate en static translations. When a fr static translation is missing, i18next will simply return the English translation values. The locales/fr/ files should exist though, so until we’ve built a process to map PFE’s dictionaries to FEM’s in combination with Lokalise, let’s only add fr/components.json and fr/screens.json files containing an empty object {}.

Good point. I'm also using Spanish to test the classifier (#3145) so I'll add `es` as well.

> Now that translated project data are coming from fetchTranslations(), I think fetchTranslations() should have a spec file with unit tests in this PR. It’s a crucial data fetching function similar to fetchProjectData().

Definitely. It's just a wrapper for `GET https://www.zooniverse.org/api?translated_type=project_page&translated_id=1234&language=fr`, which should be easy to test.

There's also repeated code in the About page code which could be moved into a function. I'm not sure if that would be helpful, but it would allow it to be tested.

>In getStaticPageProps.spec, should a unit test be added to check the function is returning strings? I see a lot of unit tests for returned workflows data, but not for project data.

Good point. Now that we have locales, we probably want some tests for localised projects, which will be used for the page header on every page.

>When someone tries to visit /fr/ for a project without french project translations, the app crashes instead of rendering the 404 page. I tried this on i-fancy-cats. I think there needs to be some error handling in getStaticPageProps() when strings does not exist.

👍 

>I noticed ProjectAboutPage’s page title isn’t a static translation with i18next anymore. I think it makes most sense for the page title to always match the AboutSidebar navigation labels, and therefore be controlled as a static translation by the Zooniverse team. Perhaps project about pages’ titles should not be mutable in pandora and strings = { content }. What do you think?

Pandora isn't very opinionated about what's translated. I think it enumerates `translations.strings` and `translations.string_versions` in the Panoptes response, and shows an editor for each key/value pair. If we want to change the content of `strings`, that's a change to be made in Panoptes somewhere. It might be worth checking how projects are editing page titles at the moment. If they set their own page titles, then we should let them continue. If not, then we can use static titles. I think the static translations also need to be passed to the page `<head>`, so that the `<title>` tag shows the page title in the correct language. At the moment, I'm passing `strings.title` as the page title that's shown in the document head.

pull_request.title: Project app: Localise project and project_pages
pull_request.body:
Hook up `app_project` to the Panoptes `/translations` API for both the project and project page content. Workflows are already localised.
- Project translations are fetched after the project loads.
- Translated project fields are replaced by views, which are aliases for the corresponding translation strings.
- Project page translations are fetched in the page controller for each page, with the strings being added to each page as `page.strings`.
- `page.strings` is used to display the title and content of each page.

## Package
app-project

## Linked Issue and/or Talk Post

## How to Review
I've mocked a French locale for testing, so you should be able to browse French translations, from Panoptes, for PH-TESS at:
https://local.zooniverse.org:3000/projects/fr/nora-dot-eisner/planet-hunters-tess?env=production

# Checklist
_PR Creator - Please cater the checklist to fit the review needed for your code changes._
_PR Reviewer - Use the checklist during your review. Each point should be checkmarked or discussed before PR approval._

## General
- [ ] Tests are passing locally and on Github
- [ ] Documentation is up to date and changelog has been updated if appropriate
- [ ] You can `yarn panic && yarn bootstrap` or `docker-compose up --build` and FEM works as expected
- [ ] FEM works in all major desktop browsers: Firefox, Chrome, Edge, Safari (Use Browserstack account as needed)
- [ ] FEM works in a mobile browser

## General UX
Example Staging Project: [i-fancy-cats](https://local.zooniverse.org:3000/projects/brooke/i-fancy-cats)
- [ ] All pages of a FEM project load: Home Page, Classify Page, and About Pages
- [ ] Can submit a classification
- [ ] Can sign-in and sign-out
- [ ] The component is accessible
  - Can be used with a screen reader [BBC guide to VoiceOver](https://bbc.github.io/accessibility-news-and-you/accessibility-and-testing-with-voiceover-os.html)
  - Can be used from the keyboard [WebAIM guide to keyboard testing](https://webaim.org/techniques/keyboard/#testing)
  - It is passing accessibility checks in the storybook

## New Feature
- [ ] The PR creator has listed user actions to use when testing the new feature
- [ ] Unit tests are included for the new feature
- [ ] A storybook story has been created or updated
  - Example of SlideTutorial [component](https://github.com/zooniverse/front-end-monorepo/blob/master/packages/lib-classifier/src/components/Classifier/components/SlideTutorial/SlideTutorial.js) with docgen comments, and its [story](https://zooniverse.github.io/front-end-monorepo/@zooniverse/classifier/index.html?path=/docs/other-slidetutorial--default)

comment.body: You're right. I saw two pages in the mock, so changed this, but there should be three in the links array. Something else is going on here.

pull_request.title: Project app: Localise project and project_pages
pull_request.body:
Hook up `app_project` to the Panoptes `/translations` API for both the project and project page content. Workflows are already localised.
- Project translations are fetched after the project loads.
- Translated project fields are replaced by views, which are aliases for the corresponding translation strings.
- Project page translations are fetched in the page controller for each page, with the strings being added to each page as `page.strings`.
- `page.strings` is used to display the title and content of each page.

## Package
app-project

## Linked Issue and/or Talk Post

## How to Review
I've mocked a French locale for testing, so you should be able to browse French translations, from Panoptes, for PH-TESS at:
https://local.zooniverse.org:3000/projects/fr/nora-dot-eisner/planet-hunters-tess?env=production

# Checklist
_PR Creator - Please cater the checklist to fit the review needed for your code changes._
_PR Reviewer - Use the checklist during your review. Each point should be checkmarked or discussed before PR approval._

## General
- [ ] Tests are passing locally and on Github
- [ ] Documentation is up to date and changelog has been updated if appropriate
- [ ] You can `yarn panic && yarn bootstrap` or `docker-compose up --build` and FEM works as expected
- [ ] FEM works in all major desktop browsers: Firefox, Chrome, Edge, Safari (Use Browserstack account as needed)
- [ ] FEM works in a mobile browser

## General UX
Example Staging Project: [i-fancy-cats](https://local.zooniverse.org:3000/projects/brooke/i-fancy-cats)
- [ ] All pages of a FEM project load: Home Page, Classify Page, and About Pages
- [ ] Can submit a classification
- [ ] Can sign-in and sign-out
- [ ] The component is accessible
  - Can be used with a screen reader [BBC guide to VoiceOver](https://bbc.github.io/accessibility-news-and-you/accessibility-and-testing-with-voiceover-os.html)
  - Can be used from the keyboard [WebAIM guide to keyboard testing](https://webaim.org/techniques/keyboard/#testing)
  - It is passing accessibility checks in the storybook

## New Feature
- [ ] The PR creator has listed user actions to use when testing the new feature
- [ ] Unit tests are included for the new feature
- [ ] A storybook story has been created or updated
  - Example of SlideTutorial [component](https://github.com/zooniverse/front-end-monorepo/blob/master/packages/lib-classifier/src/components/Classifier/components/SlideTutorial/SlideTutorial.js) with docgen comments, and its [story](https://zooniverse.github.io/front-end-monorepo/@zooniverse/classifier/index.html?path=/docs/other-slidetutorial--default)

commits.message:
Classifier: Localise workflows
Wire up workflows to the Panoptes `/translations` endpoint.
- Add a `useTranslations` hook to fetch translations by type, ID and language.
- Add a `strings` property to workflows and tasks, which holds the dictionary of translated strings for that resource.
- Modify the data vis annotation task to show instructions, help, and tool labels from the `strings` dictionary.
- Add a `language` query param to the dev classifier.

issue.title: Inaccessible links for programmes
issue.body:
The first links a user of the site encounters are inaccessible. 

- Each link uses the same text: 'Enter'. Link text should tell me where I'm going, particularly if I'm using the page in a screen reader. 

- The clickable area is tiny. In the screenshot, tapping on either the graphic or the title does nothing. The actual link is the tiny text at the bottom of the screen.

![Screenshot of Activities For Undergraduates on the home page. There's a large graphic (not clickable), the programme title (also not clickable) and a teeny tiny Enter link at the bottom of the screen.](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59547/168983108-732946ca-c417-4c9a-9996-55323b3e637c.jpeg)
## Recommendation 

Wrap the whole card in an anchor, to make it clickable, and set the link text to the programme title.

![Screenshot of Activities For Undergraduates on the home page. There's a large graphic (not clickable), the programme title (also not clickable) and a teeny tiny Enter link at the bottom of the screen.](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59547/168981936-496b4389-3207-467e-8015-800edfbe190c.jpeg)

## Recommendation 

Wrap the whole card in an anchor, to make it clickable, and set the link text to the programme title.
